column4: oka, I mistakenly added a word to the dictionary which seem to follow me in ubuntu... Anyone know how to delete it?
which dictionary?
can you specify what you mean by 'it is present'?
you should write a script for that purpose
find . -type f
do not paste stuff here
and that is not output from find . -type f
I thought you meant a command to display only files that are not links
you can look through the output of ls -l -- if anything starts with 'l' (that's lower case L) it's a link
yes
there are no links listed
But many of them files indicates of two or three number of links, why?
now I see what you mean
I've always ignored that number. It indicates the number of hard links.
so, what's the problem now?
you mustn't think of it as one of them containing the 'real data'. That's only with symbolic links.
they all contain the real data, and the real data will be there until you delete the last link.
they are separate and unique files. They just happen to point to the same data
Hmm, okay, thank you for the hlpe
you choose the session at the login window
it's not supposed to be
no swearing please
find out what's hogging your CPU
find out if something is hogging your CPU. trackerd does that sometimes
